title: Rwanda: Agri-Business Dealers Urged to Extend Agricultural Inputs to Farmers On Time
text:
Rwanda: Former Energy State Minister Albert Butare Wins Lifetime Achievement Award 
"We want farmers to focus on increased productivity through using quality seeds such that we achieve our goals," he said. 
Musabyimana cited beans, soya, bananas, rice, maize and Irish potatoes as some of the crops farmers should focus on. He said such crops are marketable and help improve productivity and food security. 
Agriculture employs over 80% of the country's total population and contributes 31% to GDP. The sector is expected to grow by 5.2% in 2015 and will continue to grow by 5.3% in 2016. 
According to the 2015/2016 budget, government allocated Frw 120.6 billion to the agriculture sector. The money will be spent on key areas such as crop intensification, the second phase of rural sector support project, hillside irrigation and water harvesting, livestock infrastructure program, the national strategic food reserve and pro-harvest agribusiness projects and the rehabilitation of roads and feeder roads to provide access to markets.
